abstractContent.text: and dick((~merl.coin Lexicalized context-free grammar (LCFG) is an attractive compromise between the parsing efficiency of context-free grammar (CFC) and the elegance and lexical sensitivity of lexicalized tree-adjoining grammar (LTAG).
LCFC is a restricted form of LTAG that can only generate context-free languages and can be parsed in cubic time.
However, LCF(I supports much of the elegance of LTAG's analysis of English and shares with LTAG the ability to lexicalize CF(I;s without changing the trees generated.
